member.name: M:Ace.Adept.Server.Controls.AdeptControllerUtil.ToDateTime(System.Int64)
member.summary: Convert the elapsed seconds since Unix epoch (Jan 1st, 1970 at midnight UTC) to a timestamp
member.returns: Timestamp (UTC)
member.remarks: Unix time, or POSIX time, is a system for describing instants in time, defined as the number of seconds elapsed since midnight Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) of Thursday, January 1, 1970 (Unix times are defined, but negative, before that date), not counting leap seconds, which are declared by the International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service and are not predictable (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

member.name: M:Ace.Adept.Server.Controls.AdeptControllerUtil.ToUnixTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Convert a timestamp to elapsed seconds since Unix epoch (Jan 1st, 1970 at midnight UTC)
member.returns: Seconds since Unix epoch
member.remarks: Unix time, or POSIX time, is a system for describing instants in time, defined as the number of seconds elapsed since midnight Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) of Thursday, January 1, 1970 (Unix times are defined, but negative, before that date), not counting leap seconds, which are declared by the International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service and are not predictable (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

member.summary: Recursively copy a V+ directory to the PC, creating directories as necessary and posting progress reports. Throws a "Directory not found" exception if the V+ directory is missing.
member.param: The V+ source directory, such as "D:\mydir".

An optional event handler that will receive progress events. If null, no event-reporting is performed.

An optional event handler that will receive progress events. If null, no event-reporting is performed.

member.name: M:Ace.Adept.Server.Controls.IAdeptController.InvokeVPlusProgram(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Invoke a generic V+ program. The V+ program must be of the form .PROGRAM my_prog() Note that the program should not run for a long period of time, since it will hang one of the communication tasks. In that case, you should use ExecuteVPlusInstruction with an argument of "EXECUTE n my_prog()", to start the long-running program in its own task. Parameters may be passed and returned from the program using global variables, together with the GetRealValue to get values and ExecuteVPlusInstruction to set values.
member.param: Number of the robot command queue in which to execute. These do NOT correspond to V+ task numbers. Use 1 for robot 1's queue, 2 for robot 2's queue, etc. Use 0 for a non-robot queue.
Name of the program to invoke.

member.name: M:Ace.Adept.Server.Desktop.Connection.IVpLink.Open(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Try to connect to the controller using the given connection info.
member.param: The name of the physical device to use to connect. The recognized names are: UDP, TCP, and COM1 - COM16
unit number of device, if necessary
name of V+ system to which to connect. This can be an IP address, for instance.
For serial communications this is flow control: 0=none, 1=XonXoff, 2=RTS/CTS, 3=Both. For a TCP connection, this is a port offset added to the default ports.
For serial comm this is the serial line settings in format "BBBB,P,D,S" (baud rate, parity, data bits, stop bits) if empty, the default is "9600,N,8,1".

member.name: T:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration
member.summary: Interface for configuring ESTOP hardware delay

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.NominalHardwareDelay
member.summary: Nominal value for the delay (in ms) across safety circuit. The observed delay should be within a specified range of the default delay, if this value has not be overridden by the user after the robot was commissioned at the factory.
member.remarks: The nominal delay might be very different from the observed delay based on the resistor value that was set during commissioning.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.NominalResolution
member.summary: Nominal resolution is the amount of additional delay achieved by incrementing the resistor value by 1.
member.remarks: Empirical data shows that this resolution value is around 75/32 = 2.34375. This value is rounded off to 3.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.AcceptableHardwareDelayDeviation
member.summary: The acceptable delay deviation (in ms) is used to determine the acceptable range for the observed delay.
member.remarks: This value usually depends on the pots and the millisecond resolution that can be achieved. The acceptable range for the observed delay is between (DefaultHardwareDelay - AcceptableHardwareDelayDeviation) and (DefaultHardwareDelay + AcceptableHardwareDelayDeviation)

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.MinResistorValue
member.summary: Minimum programmable resistor value

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.MaxResistorValue
member.summary: Maximum programmable resistor value

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.MaximumObservableDelay
member.summary: Maximum observable delay (in ms) over the safety circuit

member.summary: Gets or sets the delay configured for each channel

member.summary: Checks whether power was disabled by hardware

member.summary: Gets the delay resistor value across a channel on the ESTOP safety circuit
member.returns: Sum of the values across both resistors on a given channel. -1 is returned if the system is unable to retrieve the delay resistor value

member.name: M:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.SetChannelDelayResistorValue(Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.EStopChannel,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the delay resistor value across a channel on the ESTOP safety circuit
member.param: Desired sum of the values across both resistors on a given channel
member.returns: true if resistor value was successfully modified, false if unable to set resistor value

member.summary: Reset the inhibit safety relays to allow enabling power after commissioning the ESTOP delays

member.summary: Gets the observed hardware delay (in ms) across the specified ESTOP channel of the ESTOP safety circuit
member.returns: Observed hardware delay across the specified channel. -1 is returned if the delay cannot be read

member.name: M:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.TriggerDelayCircuit
member.summary: Trigger the EStop Delay Circuit
member.returns: true if successfully triggered delay circuit, false if failed

member.summary: Gets the observed hardware delays (in ms) across both channels of the ESTOP safety circuit
member.returns: Observed hardware delay across both ESTOP channels

member.summary: An error reading the A/B phases of an incremental encoder has been detected. This is due to an illegal state change, such as from high-high to low-low, without going through the required high-low or low-high steps.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum output command to the motors (32767 is max).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.DutyCycleOutputLimit1

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.DutyCycleFilterPole1
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Duty cycle exceeded* low-pass filter pole. A high value will increase the time constant used the duty-cycle filter to declare *Duty-cycle exceeded* errors. A value of 9 is typical.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.DutyCycleOutputLimit2
member.summary: Gets or sets the filtered output command limit a duty cycle error will be declared. This should be less than MaximumOutputLevel.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.DutyCycleFilterPole2
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Duty cycle exceeded* low-pass filter pole. A high value will increase the time constant used the duty-cycle filter to declare *Duty-cycle exceeded* errors. A value of 9 is typical.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.DutyCycleOutputLimit3
member.summary: Gets or sets the filtered output command limit a duty cycle error will be declared. This should be less than MaximumOutputLevel.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.DutyCycleFilterPole3
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Duty cycle exceeded* low-pass filter pole. A high value will increase the time constant used the duty-cycle filter to declare *Duty-cycle exceeded* errors. A value of 9 is typical.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.LastMotionSettlingTime
member.summary: The motor settling time, in milliseconds, for the last motion completed.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.VoltageOverheadOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag enabling higher motor speeds by automatically offsetting the amplifier's PWM duty-cycle values in order to maximize the voltage that can be applied to the motor windings. This can increase the maximum motor speed by as much as 13%.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.SoftEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Soft envelope error* limit (cts). When the position error exceeds this value, V+ decelerates the robot to a controlled stop.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.HardEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Hard envelope error* limit (cts). When the position error exceeds this value, the servos immediately shut down the amplifier and engage the brakes.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.VelocityEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity envelope error limit (cts/msec). When the velocity error exceeds this value, a *Hard envelope error* is declared.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.ManualModeEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a special *Soft envelope error* limit (cts). When the position error exceeds this value in manual mode, V+ decelerates the robot to a controlled stop.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.ReverseTorque
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the torque output command. Exercise care when changing this value--the wrong value can cause the motor to run away.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.ReverseCommutation
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the motor phase commutation order. Exercise care when changing this value--the wrong value can cause the motor to run away.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.EncoderConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets encoder configuration flags.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.InputPolarityConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets motor input polarity flags.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.MotorStalledTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) in which a *Motor stalled timeout* will be declared if the output level remains saturated at its limiting value.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.ZeroIndexSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of encoder counts between zero indexes (zero to disable).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotor.ReverseEncoder
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of positive encoder counting. Exercise care when changing this value--the wrong value can cause the motor to run away.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default acceleration time (msec) for motor moves. This is normally used when directly giving move commands to the motors.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time required to be in tolerance (sec).

member.summary: Gets or sets the settling tolerance filter pole.

member.summary: Gets or sets the commanded position. Be careful setting the commanded position--it can cause a sudden motion.

member.name: T:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains
member.summary: Motor gains.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.Motor
member.summary: Gets the motor associated with this gain set.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.ProportionalGain
member.summary: Gets or sets the servo proportional gain. Higher gain causes "tighter" servo control, considered good until it is so high that oscillation begins.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.Zero
member.summary: Gets or sets the zero in the feedback loop. It provides low-pass filtering of the feedback signal, which can eliminate some noise but can also cause instability. Typically, this is set to a value between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.Pole
member.summary: Gets or sets the pole in the feedback loops. Values close to 1 (but below 1) provide damping, which helps stabilize the feedback loop.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.IntegratorGain
member.summary: Gets or sets the feedback loop integrator gain, used to eliminate steady-state errors. It produces a torque proportional to the sum (integral) of all previous errors. Too low a value can cause errors to take a long time to go to zero. Too high a value can cause oscillations that never damp out.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.MaxIntegratorValue
member.summary: A limit on the accumulated error that the integrator will achieve, in output counts from 0 to 32767. A value of 0 disables the integrator. A higher value increases possible integrator action. A value of 32767 is appropriate in most cases.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.MaxPositionErrorToIntegrate
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest position error to integrate (cts) per servo cycle. This effectively decreases the integrator gain for errors larger than this value, helping prevent integrator "windup".

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.CompensatorGain
member.summary: Gets or sets a multiplier applied at the end of the control loop.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.VelocityFeedforward
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity feed-forward gain (output/(cts/msec)). This outputs a torque proportional to commanded velocity. It can reduce tracking errors on systems with significant viscous friction. Since it is a feedforward gain, it has no effect on stability.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.AccelerationFeedforward
member.summary: Gets or sets the acceleration feed-forward gain (output/(cts/msec^2)). This outputs a torque proportional to commanded acceleration. It can reduce tracking errors on systems with significant mass. Since it is a feedforward gain, it has no effect on stability.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.DacOutputFilterPole
member.summary: Gets or sets a low-pass smoothing filter pole on the output command. Typically, this is kept at 0; on some systems with high-frequency resonances, a value of 1 or 2 may be acceptable. Higher values tend to cause low-frequency oscillation.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.AdaptiveFeedforwardControl
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether single-axis adaptive feedforward control is used. If enabled, velocity and acceleration feedforward are disabled.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.SecondOrderFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets second-order filter parameters, in the form 'poleFrequency dampingRatio'. If poleFrequency is zero, the second-order filter is disabled. If poleFrequency is non-zero and dampingRatio is zero, a low-pass filter is created. If both are non-zero, a notch filter is created.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMaximumTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum commanded speed (cts/msec) that will saturate the static friction compensation torque to the maximum positive or negative value. Set this value to 0 to disable static friction compensation.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMinimumTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum commanded speed (cts/msec) at which the static friction compensation torque will begin to take effect.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMaximumPositiveValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum positive static friction torque value. Typically, this is the same as the maximum negative value. The full value will be achieved at positive speeds exceeding the maximum trigger value.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMaximumNegativeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum negative static friction torque value. Typically, this is the same as the maximum positive value. The full value will be achieved at negative speeds below the maximum trigger value.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardTimeConstant
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount by which the static friction compensation leads or lags the commanded velocity.
member.remarks: If the value is positive, the static friction compensation will lead the servo set point. If the value is negative, the static friction compensation will be delayed compared to the commanded velocity. This allows the static friction feedforward compensation to be synchronized, as much as possible, with commanded velocity.

member.name: T:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs
member.summary: Encapsulates robot Cartesian motion specifications.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.Robot
member.summary: Gets the robot associated with this parameter set.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.ErrorDeceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of normal deceleration to use during error conditions (E-stop, for example). A value of 0 will use default deceleration. Requires hardware to leave power on long enough to decelerate, and robot option bit 11 must be set.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.StartupSCurveProfile
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the default S-curve acceleration profile at system startup. A value of 0 indicates to use no S-curve profile (trapezoidal velocity profile).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.StartupAcceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets the default percentage of rated acceleration to use at system startup.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.StartupDeceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets the default percentage of rated deceleration to use at system startup.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.MaxPercentAcceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable acceleration from an ACCEL command.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.MaxPercentDeceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable deceleration from an ACCEL command.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.MaxPercentSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable speed from a SPEED command.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.MonitorSpeedRateOfChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum rate of change of monitor speed (%/sec).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.ScaleAccelUpperLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the program speed above which accelerations are saturated.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.CartesianTranslationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cartesian translation speed at speed 100 (mm/sec).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.CartesianTranslationAccel
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cartesian translation accel at accel 100 (mm/sec^2).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.CartesianRotationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cartesian rotation speed at speed 100 (deg/sec).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.CartesianRotationAccel
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cartesian rotation accel at accel 100 (deg/sec^2).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.MaxWorldToolManualTranslationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum World/Tool pendant translational speed (mm/sec)

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.MaxWorldToolManualRotationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum World/Tool pendant rotational speed (deg/sec)

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotMotionSpecs.TimeToMaxWorldToolManualSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the time to reach maximum World/Tool speed (sec).

member.name: T:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs
member.summary: Encapsulates robot timing specifications.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.AutoModeEStopShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) after an auto mode E-stop is asserted in which case V+ is allowed to decelerate the robot, engage the brakes, and shutdown power before the servo nodes automatically shut down power. Values range from 0 (immediate power off) to 0.512 seconds. If E-stop hardware delay is configured, then the maximum value allowed is 16 ms less than the E-stop hardware delay. If the deceleration is too slow or the brake-on delay too long, the servo node will automatically cut power.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.BrakeEngageDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay (in sec) from the moment the brakes are engaged until servo control is disabled. This helps prevent the robot from dropping due to the time it takes the brakes to fully engage.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.BrakeReleaseDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay (in sec) from the moment brakes are released until the trajectory generator starts moving the robot. This helps prevent the robot from moving prematurely while the brakes are still partially engaged.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.DriveEnableTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time (sec) that V+ will wait after enabling the amplifier for it to indicate that it has successfully enabled. A *Timeout enabling amplifier* will occur if the timeout expires.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.HoldToRunEStopShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) after a hold-to-run mode E-stop is asserted in which V+ is allowed to decelerate the robot, engage the brakes, and shutdown power before the servo nodes automatically shut down power. Values range from 0 (immediate power off) to 0.512 seconds. If the deceleration is too slow or the brake-on delay too long, the servo node will automatically cut power.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.ManualModeEStopShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) after a manual mode E-stop is asserted in which V+ is allowed to decelerate the robot, engage the brakes, and shutdown power before the servo nodes automatically shut down power. Values range from 0 (immediate power off) to 0.512 seconds. If E-stop hardware delay is configured, then the maximum value allowed is 16 ms less than the E-stop hardware delay. If the deceleration is too slow or the brake-on delay too long, the servo node will automatically cut power.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.MaxTimeToWaitForAmpPower
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time (sec) that V+ will wait for the servos to indicate successful power-up after enabling power. A *Timeout enabling high power* will occur if the timeout expires.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.NullingTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the controller will wait for nulling position errors (getting within the COARSE or FINE tolerance on all motors) before declaring a *Time-out nulling error*.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.PowerOnToAmpOnDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay (sec) from the time high power is turned on until the amplifiers are enabled. This allows the amplifiers time to reset.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.IRobotTimingSpecs.Robot
member.summary: Gets the robot associated with this parameter set.

member.name: T:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveConfiguration
member.summary: Base class for specifying the "move configuration" that helps resolve ambiguous decisions about moving a robot to achieve a given Cartesian position.
member.remarks: For example, track-driven SCARA robots have many ways of reaching a particular position; the move configuration for a track-driven SCARA adds enough information to allow the trajectory generator to decide where to move each joint.

member.summary: Get or set the motion speed. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing rated speed.

member.summary: Get or set the motion speed. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing rated speed.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveParameters.SpeedMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the straight-line speed mode. This parameter is ignored for non-straight moves, for which speed is always a percent.

member.summary: Get or set the motion acceleration. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing full acceleration.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveParameters.Decel
member.summary: Get or set the motion deceleration. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing full deceleration.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveParameters.Duration
member.summary: Get or set the minimum motion duration (sec). The actual motion duration may be longer if limited by the commanded speeds and accelerations.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveParameters.SCurveProfile
member.summary: Get or set the S-curve profile number, from 0 (for trapezoidal) to 8, or -1 to leave unchanged.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveParameters.Straight
member.summary: Get or set a flag indicating whether the motion should be straight-line. If false, motion will be joint-interpolated.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveParameters.MotionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the way to end a move: whether to complete move without nulling errors (NoNull), blend, or settle.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveParameters.SettlePercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of the nominal settling distance to use. This is only used if the "Motion End" property is set to "Settle Fine" or "Settle Coarse".

member.name: F:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveSpeedMode.Mmps
member.summary: Move speed is expressed in millimeters per second. Only used for straight-line motions; ignored for joint-interpolated motions.

member.name: F:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.MoveSpeedMode.Ips

member.name: T:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.Obstacle
member.summary: A robot obstacle. Depending on the configuration, the robot tool tip must remain external to the obstacle, or internal to it. An error is generated if the tool tip contacts the obstacle.
member.remarks:
Obstacle types and dimensions:
Box with center at Dimension0=X, Dimension1=Y, Dimension2=Z.
Cylinder with Dimension0=Radius, Dimension1=Height along Z.
Sphere with Dimension0=Radius.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.Obstacle.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the obstacle is at a default/uninitialized state.
member.value: true if this instance is default; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.Obstacle.IsContainment
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the obstacle is a containment obstacle.
member.value: true if this instance represents a containment shape; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the obstacle type.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.Obstacle.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the obstacle location, in relation to robot base.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.Obstacle.Dimension0
member.summary: Gets or sets the first obstacle dimension. Box: X (mm). Cylinder or Sphere: Radius (mm).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.Obstacle.Dimension1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first obstacle dimension. Box: Y (mm). Cylinder: Height (mm).

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.Obstacle.Dimension2
member.summary: Gets or sets the first obstacle dimension. Box: Z (mm).

member.name: T:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.SCurveProfile
member.summary: A description of a V+ S-curve profile. An S-curve can smooth the trajectory into an "S" shape by limiting the rate of change of acceleration. Robots with flexible links or drive trains can benefit from S-curves to reduce oscillation.
member.remarks: An S-curve profile is defined by the ramp-up and ramp-down times during the acceleration and deceleration phases. S-curve profile 0 is the default trapezoidal velocity profile, with ramp-up and ramp-down times all zero. Profile 0 results in the fastest but least smooth motions. Profiles 1-8 may be defined to get smoother motions by lengthening the ramp-up and ramp-down times.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.SCurveProfile.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether this profile is enabled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the acceleration ramp-up time, in seconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets the acceleration ramp-down time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.SCurveProfile.DecelerationRampUpTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the deceleration ramp-up time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.SCurveProfile.DecelerationRampDownTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the deceleration ramp-down time, in seconds.

member.name: M:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.SCurveProfile.ToString

member.name: F:Ace.Adept.Server.Motion.ServoData.VPlusCommand
member.summary:
V+ command code. Valid commands are:
0: Current mode. Arg: DAC output.
1: Free mode. Arg: DAC output.
2: Position mode. Arg: Scaled position command.
3: Set position. Arg: Scaled position.
4: Amp command. Arg: 1 to enable, 0 to disable.
5: Cal mode. Arg: None.
7: Adjust position. Arg: Scaled position offset.
8: Clear latched errors. Arg: Bit mask to clear.
9: Drive motor. Arg: Scaled position.
0xF: NOP. Arg: None.
0x10: High power. Arg: 1 to turn on, 0 to turn off.
0x11: Brake rel. Arg: 1 to release, 0 to engage.
0x12: Velocity mode Arg: Target velocity.

member.name: T:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject
member.summary: An object in the work cell with a Cartesian location. Objects that extend this class may build a "scene graph" of connections to define their location. For example, a robot may be mounted to a table, an end-effector to the robot, and a part attached to the end-effector. So the location of the object may be determined by appending the location of its parent (if any) with its offset. Cartesian objects may be rendered in 3D simulations.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.#ctor
member.summary: Create a physical object with no name.

member.summary: Deserialization constructor.
member.param: Holds all the data needed to serialize or deserialize an object.
Describes the source and destination of the serialized stream.

member.summary: Serializes data from this object, so that it can be restored later.
member.param: Holds all the data needed to serialize or deserialize an object.
Describes the source and destination of the serialized stream.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the object should be rendered in 3D simulation.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.Dispose(System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.GetReferences
member.summary: Returns all IReference objects referred to by this object. This will ensure that the references are properly handled during initialization, deletion, etc. You must override this method in objects that contain LinkedReference or EmbeddedReference objects.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.Children
member.summary: Return a list of the dependent (embedded) children of this object. Embedded objects are deleted when their parent is deleted, and so on. For example, Parts are typically embedded in a feeder.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.OffsetFromParent
member.summary: The offset from the tip of the parent object (or the world origin if the parent is null) to the base of this object.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.UpdateParentOffset(Ace.Core.Server.Transform3D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the parent offset directly and specify if a property change event should be thrown as part of the update process
member.param: if set to true a property change event will be thrown.

member.name: M:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes this object after it has been created or restored. Ensures that the visible flag is set properly.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.Parent
member.summary: The parent of this object, or null if it is relative to the world origin. The parent is the object to which this object is attached--if the parent moves, so do all of its children.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.WorldLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the world location of the object as specified in workspace coordinates.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.OffsetToTip
member.summary: The offset from the base of this object to its tip. Often, this is the identity transform.

member.name: P:Ace.Core.Server.CartesianObject.ParentLocation
member.summary: World location of the parent of this object, or the identity transform if this object has no parent.
